div1.p: Dunn outlines her recent expenses and provides a bill for secretary Whiting.
I received your letter (with check enclosed) in which you requested me to state what part of my Bill was for expenses, and what was Salary.

I thought my last letter was sufficiently plain except the absence of items and will now forward them herewith. I informed you in my last that as I came by way of Washington, and as that is a different Route from what you are sending Teachers, you may think it is advisable to make a deduction from my Bill if so, please do so.

closer.signed:
Miss A. A. Dunn
Box 115 Staunton Va.
closer.seg:

Fare from Boston to Washington. $13.00
Hack fare in Washington. . . . . . .50

Fare from Washington to Staunton $9.00
